cs.PL, cs.LO, cs.SE, cs.FL, cs.CL. 

This paper deals with the application of Constraint Handling Rules (CHR) for the specification of type inference systems, which is a topic related to programming languages (PL) and logic in computer science (LO). The paper also discusses the consistency of CHR-based type inference, which is a topic related to software engineering (SE) and formal languages and automata theory (FL). Additionally, the paper discusses the termination and confluence of CHR programs, which are topics related to computational logic (CL). Therefore, the most likely arXiv CS sub-categories for this paper are cs.PL and cs.LO, followed by cs.SE, cs.FL, and cs.CL.
